question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
When Frederick was born, his grandparents gave him a gift of $\$2000$, which was invested at a simple interest rate of $5\%$ per year.  How much money will Frederick have when he can collect the money at the age of $18$?  (Assume no money is added to the account besides the interest.)
inference: Final Answer: \\boxed{\$3800}. I hope it is correct.
ground_truth: If the interest is simple, then Frederick's money grows by $\allowbreak .05(2000)=100$ dollars per year.  This means he gained $18\times100=\$1800$, so he has a total of $2000+1800=\boxed{\$3800}$.
